intro: Gypsophila hirsuta var. ocellata, commonly known as the "Chinese laceflower," is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feathery foliage and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its flowers are often used in floral arrangements due to their airy appearance and long-lasting nature. The variety 'ocellata' is distinguished by its distinctive central markings on the flower petals.
